title: Hailee Steinfeld reveals she shared her snacks with Mila Kunis when in the audience
text:
She's an actress, singer, and a songwriter, and now she's heading to Apple's new streaming platform Apple TV+ for her new series, Dickinson.

Hailee Steinfeld, 22, has been doing loads of press for the new series which is expected to drop this Friday.

And on Tuesday evening, she stopped by The Late Late Show with James Corden to continue her press tour where she said she shared snacks at age 14 with Mila Kunis when at the Academy Awards in 2011 for True Grit.

Big star! Hailee Steinfeld has been doing loads of press for the new series Dickinson which is expected to drop on Apple TV+ this Friday

Fun fact: When hitting the Oscars at age 14 in 2011 she said she shared her snacks with Mila Kunis; seen here with Ashton Kutcher in 2017

While on the show, she opened up about her first Oscars (for her nomination for True Grit) when she was just 14 years old and revealed she was famished throughout the long day.

'The entire day you're getting ready and then you're there and you sat down and I was just so hungry,' she revealed to the host.

'My mom had snacks... Mila was in front of me and she got wind of the snacks.' At every commercial break Mila turned around and asked her mother for snacks, she says.

For her appearance on the show, she wore a blue button up blouse paired with maroon satin pants and high heels.

Looking good: For her appearance on the show, she wore a blue button up blouse paired with maroon satin pants and high heels. She is pictured above with Gugu Mbatha-Raw

In her new series, she plays the famous poet Emily Dickinson and tells the story about being shunned by her family with a will to make a name for herself.

But that's not all, this Hollywood A-lister is in talks to land another major role for Disney's new streaming platform.

According to Variety, Steinfeld is in talks for Marvel's new Hawkeye series.

Selfie: Hailee, James Corden, and Gugu Mbatha-Raw pose for a selfie while on the show

The site reports that she has been offered the the lead role in the series of Kate Bishop.

When asked about the role at the New York premiere of Dickinson, she played coy: 'That, I don't know about! I don't know. I have no idea what you're talking about.'

It seems as though the contract is still up in the air as there may be a non-compete clause in her Apple contract between the tech giant and Disney, but her team is trying to smooth out the rough edges.

Stunning: Hailee looked radiant as she posed on the carpet for the premiere for her Apple TV+ series Dickinson on October 17

In action: Hailee is pictured above in character as Emily Dickinson on the Apple series
description: She's an actress, singer, and a songwriter, and now she's heading to Apple's new streaming platform Apple TV+ for her new series, Dickinson. Hailee Steinfeld has been doing loads of press.
